definition: it goes to show that/one can see
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: It serves to show the Chinese diet in materials and randomness of the rich.
sentences.chinese: 足见中国饮食在用料方面的随意性之广博。

sentences.english: It does show that such opinion is not correct.
sentences.chinese: 足见这种意见是不对的。

sentences.english: The infant Jesus, decapitated, was less fortunate than the Christ.
sentences.chinese: 儿时的耶稣丢了脑袋，足见他的运气不如基督。

sentences.english: Every part shows the inventive mind of the owner.
sentences.chinese: 每一个角落均有其妙处，足见主人的匠心独具。

sentences.english: All these indicate the wild ambition of Japanese Fascist militarism arid the confusion of right and wrong.
sentences.chinese: 这些足见日本法西斯军国主义的狼子野心和颠倒是非。

sentences.english: A front that is governed by the wise and knowing.
sentences.chinese: 一条战线被理智的人控制并足见被认识到。

definition: from this, it can be seen that...
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
needless to say/it goes without saying
lit. one spot (on the leopard)/fig. one small item in a big scheme
it is obvious that.../as one can well imagine...
it goes without saying/it is self-evident
as many as/no less than/not inferior to/as good as/on a par with
